quest.name: Stray into the Shadows
journal: Jacke has another assignment for you.

Jacke has tasked you with reclaiming a shipment of stolen firearms. The pirates responsible for the theft have been apprehended, but it seems the muskets had already been fenced. Speak with V'kebbe, and discuss how the job should be approached.
V'kebbe suggests you check in with one of rogues' spies to see what information can be had regarding the fenced firearms. Speak with the woman posing as a fishmonger at the Hyaline.
The “fishmonger” informs you that the pillaged muskets were purchased by a south seas organization known as the Traders of Edge. Speak with V'kebbe at the Hyaline and relay your discoveries.

After you tell V'kebbe what the spy knew of the Traders of Edge merchant, she decides that further information gathering is required. Visit the Bismarck, the ferry docks, and East Hawkers' Alley, and use your Hide ability to surreptitiously listen in on any potentially useful mutterings.
You have gathered information from your assigned locations. Rendezvous with V'kebbe in front of the Rogues' Guild and share what you have learned.

Based on the information you have gathered, V'kebbe deduces that the shady merchant means to depart by ship in the very near future. The Stray proposes her plan: wait for the trader to stack his goods on the pier, then sneak past the hired blades and steal back the Yellowjackets' firearms. Speak with V'kebbe once more when you are ready to begin the operation.
You have successfully reclaimed the stolen muskets and returned them to the Yellowjackets. Report to V'kebbe in front of the Rogues' Guild.

Jacke joins you outside the Rogues' Guild, and praises you for a job well done. While he is informing V'kebbe of the unfortunate conclusion to the missing sandwich saga, however, his deception is inadvertently revealed by the arrival of an oblivious Perimu Haurimu. V'kebbe then responds as she would to any violation of the code. Head inside the guild and see what has become of its supper-stealing guildmaster.

Suffering from several nasty rope burns but otherwise none the worse for wear, Jacke appears sincerely contrite for his act of sandwich larceny. He explains that being strung up is one of the least of the punishments a person might suffer at the hands of the rogues. Return to disciplining your body and mind that you might properly dispense justice to those that defy the code.

※The next rogue quest will be available from Jacke upon reaching level 15.
objectives: Speak with the fishmonger girl at the Hyaline.
Use Hide to gather information at the Bismarck.
Use Hide to gather information at the ferry docks.
Use Hide to gather information in East Hawkers' Alley.
Speak with V'kebbe in front of the Rogues' Guild.
Speak with V'kebbe and retrieve the firearms.
Speak with V'kebbe in front of the Rogues' Guild.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: A fine evenin'mornin'day to ye, Forename.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: An' a fine evenin'mornin'day it is for a spot o' work, wouldn't ye agree?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: This time 'round, it seems some eager buccaneers scampered aboard a local merchantman an' made off with a shipment o' muskets.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Now, seein' as it ain't lawful to cloy from a Lominsan vessel to begin with, the Yellowjackets fell upon them daft coves afore their boots was even dry.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Aye, they caught the pirates right there on the docks, but the stolen boomsticks was nowhere to be found─fenced in a longboat deal, I'm thinkin'.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: That's when our guild was officially contracted to retrieve the goods. ...Which weren't really needful, since the code would have had us on the job, anyway. “Ye don't bite the purses o' yer fellow Lominsans,” an' all that.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: So, this's yer assignment, me natty lasslad: find out where them weapons went, an' bite that shipment back.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Seein' as the cutters as hit that merchantman are already rottin' in irons, ye needn't rush in with yer stabbers a-stabbin'. I want this job handled quick an' quiet, an' I've the perfect partner to show ye how it's done.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: This here's V'kebbe the Stray. Ain't no other rogue what can match her in the arts o' skulkin'.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: ...A pleasure.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: ...There some problem, V'kebbe? Ye seem a bit out o' sorts.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: I'm bloody starvin'. I had one o' them finger sandwiches set aside─ye know, those egg-filled tasties they make at the Bismarck─but when I got back from me work, it was bloody gone...

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: (Uh-oh. That was V'kebbe's? I'd thought it was Underfoot's...)

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: <cough> Ahem! Well, ye just head out on the job, an' I'll see if I can't turn up that missin' sandwich by the time ye return!

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: ...All right, Jacke.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ah, one more little detail ye should know: them muskets was meant for the Yellowjackets' armory, so once all is bob, ye can hand the goods to one o' their culls directly.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: We can start whenever yer ready, Forename.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: I've had a colleague keepin' a wattle out for aught that might help us, so I suggest ye have a few whids with her first.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: Ye'll find her at the Hyaline, posin' as a fishmonger.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: That lass down there─the one stinkin' o' fish an' ocean. Go over an' ask her what the catch o' the day is.

dialogue.name: THIEF00126
dialogue.text: 'Ello there, misssir. We've carp an' trout, lobster an' shrimp...but I 'ear tell ye've been lookin' for a special breed o' fish─the long, shiny kind what's bark'll put a bloke on 'is arse.

dialogue.name: THIEF00126
dialogue.text: We don't sell that kind 'ere, but ye might try them foreign merchants─what was they called again?─ah, the “Traders of Edge.” They 'ail from the south sea isles, an' are known for dealin' in all types o' nasty spitters an' cutters.

dialogue.name: THIEF00126
dialogue.text: I should warn ye: these folk ain't ones for questionin' the source o' their merchandise. In fact, they seem more'n 'appy to pay for goods what came from “belowdecks,” so to speak.

dialogue.name: THIEF00126
dialogue.text: But if yer still keen to get yer 'ands on those rare fish, then ye'd best 'urry─the Edge merchant what's visitin' Limsa is lookin' to load up an' leave the city afore long.

dialogue.name: THIEF00126
dialogue.text: Just 'ow 'e means to transport 'is goods remains a mystery, though. What with all the 'ired blades 'e's got nursin' 'is operation, it makes it 'ard for a girl to get close enough to eyeball the competition, it does!

dialogue.name: THIEF00126
dialogue.text: I'll be sure to keep an eye peeled on yer behalf, but it might be as ye can learn a little more from the folk 'round town...

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: ...Traders of Edge, eh? Well, if one o' their merchant's been stayin' in the city, then someone'll know somethin' to point us in the right direction.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: The trick is to listen without bein' seen. Ye'd be surprised at how culls'll cackle when they think no one else is about.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: We'll focus on places what see plenty o' traffic. Ye can have the Bismarck, the ferry docks, and East Hawkers' Alley.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: I'll try me luck at a few other spots, then meet ye in front o' the guild when I'm done. Remember: keep hidden, keep quiet, an' keep yer wattles open.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Diving Dove is grumbling in discontent...

dialogue.name: DIVINGDOVE
dialogue.text: Ugh! The sneer on that customer's face! Does he think I can command the skillet to cook more swiftly just to meet his pressing departure schedule?

dialogue.name: DIVINGDOVE
dialogue.text: I don't know how things are done in the south seas, but here in Limsa Lominsa folk appreciate that fine cuisine cannot be rushed!

dialogue.name: DIVINGDOVE
dialogue.text: ...Come now, Dove, you must not speak ill of the patrons. Now, what was next on my list? Ah, another finger sandwich for the Dutiful Sisters. Someone there must be rather fond of eggs...

dialogue.name: DIVINGDOVE
dialogue.text: Ugh, simply infuriati─

dialogue.name: DIVINGDOVE
dialogue.text: Yes, misssir? Pray place your order with one of the servers and we'll prepare your meal with all due alacrity.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Diving Dove appears distressed over some matter. Move some distance away, then approach her again while cloaked by your Hide ability and attempt to eavesdrop on her grumbling.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Diving Dove appears distressed over some matter. Approach her while cloaked by your Hide ability and attempt to eavesdrop on her grumbling.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Rerenasu is mumbling anxiously to himself...

dialogue.name: RERENASU
dialogue.text: Curse my sense of duty... Would that I had stayed at the Wench for that extra pint instead of returning early.

dialogue.name: RERENASU
dialogue.text: I didn't ask to see anyone being bribed! And certainly not my relief pilot! I wonder what that merchant was about? Smuggling? Most likely...

dialogue.name: RERENASU
dialogue.text: Should I report this to the Yellowjackets? ...But what if I'm being watched? I could end up facedown in the harbor...

dialogue.name: RERENASU
dialogue.text: What to do, what to do...

dialogue.name: RERENASU
dialogue.text: Oh! G-Greetings, misssir! Do you seek passage to Aleport? Or Costa del Sol, perhaps?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Rerenasu appears distraught. Move some distance away, then approach him again while cloaked by your Hide ability and attempt to eavesdrop on his mumbling.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Rerenasu appears distraught. Approach him while cloaked by your Hide ability and attempt to eavesdrop on his mumbling.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Gerulf is hawking his wares to a customer...

dialogue.name: GERULF
dialogue.text: You have quite an eye for quality, sir! We've a splendid range of produce from every corner of Eorzea, but one simply cannot visit Limsa Lominsa without sampling some of the local specialties!

dialogue.name: GERULF
dialogue.text: Would you care for some freshly squeezed La Noscean orange juice? Or perhaps our famed salt cod is more to your taste...?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Gerulf continues to espouse the virtues of his merchandise, but his impassioned urgings appear to have little relevance to your assignment.

dialogue.name: GERULF
dialogue.text: An excellent choice! Might I also direct your gaze to these items on the bottom─

dialogue.name: GERULF
dialogue.text: Ah! Another customer! Welcome, welcome! Did you see aught you like? Pray stay and browse to your heart's content!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Gerulf is speaking in a low but lively tone to a nearby customer. Move some distance away, then approach him again while cloaked by your Hide ability and attempt to eavesdrop on his exhortations.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Gerulf is speaking in a low but lively tone to a nearby customer. Approach him while cloaked by your Hide ability and attempt to eavesdrop on his exhortations.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. I hope yer skulkin' went well.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: Ye might be an angel o' death with the daggers, dovecolt, but any rogue what shuns the shadows is headed for an early grave. A sneaky mortcove can nose about without riskin' a scrap, or slip herselfhimself into the best position to ambush a mark.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: Once they've seen ye, though, yer rum fun is done. Hidin' is part concealment an' part distraction, an' ye won't be disappearin' on a cove what already knows yer there.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: All right, I'm done prattlin'. What'd ye manage to learn about our musket-buyin' merchant friend?

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: Slippin' coin to a ferry pilot, was he? An' by what ye heard from that chef at the Bismarck, this trader means to hop the twig, an' soon.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: That matches with me own findin's: he's vacated his rooms at the inn an' paid his dues in full.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: Bein' a merchant, we can be sure that he won't be leavin' without his merchandise. So, here's the plan: we wait for him to stack his goods on the pier, then you ghost in an' grabble them firearms.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: I'm hopin' we can get the job done quiet an' under cover of darkmans, but it never hurts to be prepared for the worst. Sounds like he's got a small army o' sellswords on the payroll...

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: I'll send word to the Yellowjackets, an' have 'em post a cull near Hawkers' Alley. That way ye won't have far to bolt once ye've bitten the goods.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: The mark should be along any moment, Forename. Have ye got yer skulkin' boots on?

dialogue.name: EDGETRADERS00126
dialogue.text: You! You are not supposed to be here! I thought I ordered my hirelings to keep this jetty clear!

dialogue.name: EDGETRADERS00126
dialogue.text: Hm? ...One...two...three... ...There's one missing.

dialogue.name: EDGETRADERS00126
dialogue.text: My crate of muskets! It's gone!

dialogue.name: EDGETRADERS00126
dialogue.text: Thief! Stop herhim, you useless sluggards! What am I paying you for!?

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: That turned hairy, didn't it, dovecolt?

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: Once ye reached the Yellowjacket, though, the merchant called off his blades. Wise enough to cut his losses, I'll give him that.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: I'd say we're all done here. Let's head inside an' tell Jacke the bene news.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: I heard the sounds o' fightin' comin' from outside, an' now I've whiddled the cause of it. ...I thought we were aimin' for “subtle” on this job.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: That many swads, was there? But ye got the Yellowjackets what they wanted, so all's well that ends well, eh?

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: Yer on yer way to becomin' a first-class rogue, Forename.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: Aye, the job didn't unfold exactly as planned, but do ye see the value o' keepin' out o' sight? Skulkin' might seem slow, but it can save ye time─an' a fair amount o' bleedin'─in the long run.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ah, speakin' of unexpected developments... I've a bit o' bad news for ye, V'kebbe.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: I searched high an' low, but it seems some unprincipled cove has yaffled yer sandwich. There were naught but crumbs to be found.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: No... My sandwich... It was a Bismarck special...

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: Do ye know how much I was lookin' forward to that meal!? Me belly's about ready to cave in on itself!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: 'Tis a tragedy o' the highest order, love. An' ye know I can't bear to see me rogues in such distress...

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: So, I gave Underfoot a special assignment─he should be back any moment now...

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: ...with a freshly made Bismarck special finger sandwich!

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: Ye did that for me!? Yer not japin' with me, are ye, Jacke!?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: This ain't no japin' matter. 'Tis a guildmaster's responsibility to see that all his coves an' morts are at their best for the job.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Ah, Jacke, there ye are! I've got that sandwich ye ordered!

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: An' didn't the chef give me a wattle-ful when I said we was in a hurry! Maybe next time ye could think twice afore ye yaffle a fellow rogue's sup─

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: ...Oh, bollocks.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: ...Jacke. Did you eat my supper?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Now, now, lass, let's not be hasty. There's a fresh new sandwich right here for ye. No harm done, eh?

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: Ye've cloyed somethin' what belonged to me, Jacke. An' I can't ignore the code...

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ahahaha, aye, the code! We mustn't ignore the code! ...Yer havin' a laugh, aren't ye, lass? ...Lass?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Aaargh!

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: ...That might be the swiftest string-up I've ever seen.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: A punishment to fit the crime. Take a good long look, Forename.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: The code exists to preserve peace in Limsa─to keep the alleys from runnin' red with blood. This city's me home, an' I'll draw daggers on any cove fool enough to threaten that peace.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: A pointed lesson. Let's head inside, eh? Yer sandwich'll get cold.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: (-Jacke-)Hey! Do ye mean to leave me here all night!? At least ye gave me a grand view o' the harbor! ...Gods' piss, these ropes are tight!

dialogue.name: MILALA
dialogue.text: (-Yellowjacket Soldier-)And now we find ourselves indebted to the Rogues' Guild. The Rogues' Guild.

dialogue.name: MILALA
dialogue.text: (-Yellowjacket Soldier-)Hmph, the impropriety of it all. Would that I could see them occupying a cell next to those thieving pirates...

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ow... Them ropes'll leave chafe marks for a bleedin' week. I may've wriggled meself free, but that's the last time I let me belly do the thinkin'...

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: An' just think: V'kebbe strung me up over an egg sandwich. Those coves what well an' truly stomp on the code get it far worse. Keep up yer trainin', lasslad, an' ye'll soon be handin' out rogue justice yerself.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Use the Hide ability to retrieve the stolen firearms.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Deliver the firearms to the Yellowjacket near Hawkers' Alley.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text:
I've spotted the mark at the end of the pier.
Sneak over there an' lighten his load.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text:
We've no place to run...
Time to get yer stabbers out!

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text:
Slink past any other swads in yer way,
an' get them goods to the Yellowjackets.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text:
I'll lead these culls a merry chase.
Meet me in front o' the guild once all is bob!

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text:
Bollocks.
This ain't how the job was meant to end...

dialogue.name: MERCHANT
dialogue.text:
Thieves! Scoundrels!
A bonus to the one who brings me their hides!

dialogue.name: YEL
dialogue.text:
Aye, these are our stolen muskets.
The quartermaster will be pleased.
